data.title: Celebrating the incredible talent of Amy Winehouse
data.meta_description: Amy Winehouse was one the most talented people the UK has ever produced - read up on her life and career on Absolute Radio.
data.text:
Remembering Amy

It's 12 years since the death of Amy Winehouse, an incredibly talented songwriter, musician and performer who is often heralded as having one of the most beautiful voices and awe-inspiring songwriting abilities of all time.

Inspired by jazz music, Amy enjoyed huge success during her all-too-short career, releasing two studio albums 'Frank' and 'Back to Black', along with chart-topping singles 'Rehab' and 'Valerie' - changing the landscape of pop music forever.

Amy sadly died on 23rd July 2011 at the age of 27, leaving a legacy of incredible music and the Amy Winehouse Foundation, which works with young people to improve their confidence and self-esteem.

As we remember her supreme talent, depicted in the 2024 biopic of her life starring Marisa Abela, take a look back at Amy's career and everything she achieved in such a short time.

Amy Winehouse's career: A look back through her life

Which are Amy Winehouse's biggest songs?

'Rehab'

'Rehab' was written and recorded by Amy Winehouse and was released in October 2006. Produced by Mark Ronson, the track is autobiographical and tells the story of Amy's refusal to attend an alcohol rehabilitation centre. The track earned Amy three Grammy Awards and an Ivor Novello Award.

'Valerie'

A cover of The Zutons' 'Valerie', this track was another collaboration with producer Mark Ronson and is one of Amy Winehouse's most successful releases. It earned Amy a BRIT Award nomination.

'Tears Dry On Their Own'

Taken from Amy's seminal album 'Back to Black', 'Tears Dry On Their Own' was released in August 2007 as the fourth single from the LP.
